Блог Обо мне

Rosetta Stone contributes

Rosetta Stone officially joins the open-source community 05 Dec 2014

I’m incredibly happy and incredibly proud to share that Rosetta Stone is an open-source software contributor. Since I started working at Rosetta Stone a little more than a year ago, I’ve been encouraging and advocating for the company to get involved in open-source. Today, we did just that. Today is a big day for Rosetta Stone.

See my post on our product/engineering blog for the official announcement. I think the value and benefits of open-source are clear, and immeasurable. Every great engineer that I know agrees. So I couldn’t be more excited about this news.

And to top it off, I helped author our first ever open-source project! Today we released an initial version of RSTCoreDataKit, an iOS library for making Core Data easier to use. This is just a start and there’s certainly more coming. This is only the beginning.

Now go show us some love on GitHub.
